channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Boeing’s stock has climbed above a key trendline, or is that just a bull trap?
item.description: Boeing’s stock has ascended above a 1-year trendline, but that doesn’t mean investors should rush to buy.

item.title: What You Can Learn from Young Warren Buffett
item.description: A look at 10 of the legendary stockpicker’s early investments reveals his diligence, his patience—and his willingness to bet big.

item.title: Opposing Fed, ECB Outlooks Expected to Weigh on Currencies
item.description: The dollar weakened against the euro, even as it strengthened compared to other major currencies, amid opposing outlooks for the Fed and the ECB.

item.title: Forget the 4% rule. Consider this new magic number for retirement withdrawals instead.
item.description: The economy and your own spending should drive what you take out of your retirement investments, new research says.

item.title: The SALT income-tax deduction could make a comeback under Trump. But maybe not for the wealthy.
item.description: Trump economic adviser Steven Moore floated raising the cap from $10,000 to $20,000.

item.title: My husband filed for divorce, but did not contribute one penny towards the mortgage. Is he entitled to half of our home?
item.description: “He forced me to pay every payment.”

item.title: Broadcom is closing in on $1 trillion market cap. Here’s how many other companies have achieved that lofty status.
item.description: Shares of Broadcom were soaring Friday following a bullish forecast on sales of artificial-intelligence chips, putting the company on the cusp of beco...

item.title: Copper's Downside Risks to Rise in 2025
item.description: LME three-month copper was down. According to ING, the metal’s downside risks have increased since Donald Trump’s election amid threats of tariffs on ...

item.title: U.S. Stocks Slip While Broadcom Rallies
item.description: All three major indexes were lower as concerns about softer spending by lower-income customers dragged down consumer-goods stocks. Meanwhile, Broadcom...

item.title: Europe's Gas Price Extends Losses on Warmer Weather
item.description: European natural-gas prices fell below 42 euros a megawatt hour on warmer weather forecasts and higher power generation, analysts said.
